title: keen 6 backdoor passwords
content:
Keen 6 has passwords like spear of destiny does to play the game.

I found out spear of destiny has backdoor passwords:

JOSHUA

PELT

SNOOPS

Do you think keen 6 might have backdoor passwords too?

title: Re: keen 6 backdoor passwords
content:
Haven't heard of any, but it's an interesting thought. Not entirely impossible that there'd be some. I tried to find, but couldn't, however. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: codes
content: A disassembly or hex dump might help in finding out, right?

title: Re: codes
content: Where is all the text stored in Keen 4+? I went through the files with a hex editor but couldn't find any straight text. The names must be stored in there somewehere.

title: Re: codes
content: Its probably encrypted. I think keen dreams has a backdoor pass because i remember seeing some people playing a hidden level in it.

title: Re: codes
content:
"A disassembly or hex dump might help in finding out, right?"
Well, that was what I was trying. I did find the enemy name texts, however, but not at least among them was anything hidden words. Those might be of course hidden encrypted somewhere. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

"Where is all the text stored in Keen 4+? I went through the files with a hex editor but couldn't find any straight text. The names must be stored in there somewehere."
All the text is stored in the game exe, as far as I know. Now the Question: Did You Unlzexe Your Exe? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: codes
content:
[hr]KeenRush Did You Unlzexe Your Exe? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
[hr][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img]

No sign of that stuff in Keen 6, though. Maybe Andy has some idea, since he has managed to extract the ending text using Modkeen2.

title: Re: codes
content: I know Rise of the Triad stores all the cheat codes backwards in the .exe, and given Keen6's copy protection I wouldn't be surprised if the answers to those questions are encrypted - but I'm not sure what a secret password might do exactly, I thought the passwords just allowed access to the game.

title: password
content: In this case, the 'backdoor' password would allow access to the game, regardless of which monster was requested.

title: Re: password
content:
"and given Keen6's copy protection I wouldn't be surprised if the answers to those questions are encrypted"
I already told, they are in normal text form. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Written in all-capitals. Naturally I'm talking here about the enemy names..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: password
content: Oh sorry, I didn't realise you were talking about the passwords - well if you've seen the passwords in the .exe and there were no unusual ones, I think that answers this question...

title: password...
content:
Really?

Well, I'm not done trying to find one but I guess they weren't thinking about backdoor passwords when they made keen 6.

Hey does anyone want a modified keen 6 .EXE with the copy right password part taken out?


[center] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] [/center]

content:
A backdoor password would be cool for keen 6, I cant find one.
